website_summaries.verdict: This book gives your child two activities in one. First, complete the cutting project; then, glue and craft with the cutout.
pros: Book includes 20 pre-printed cutting activities and a pair of safety scissors
Includes lines, animals, mazes, and other patterns
Can use cutouts for crafts once child is done cutting
cons: If your child has trouble, you may wish to buy a different pair

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old granddaughter who is just learning how to use her scissors. I know she will love it. I was a preschool teacher for years and kids really need these types of activities. For those of you thinking of teaching this to your kids, a rule of thumb that will help is to have the child hold the scissors in front of their tummy, and move the paper, not the scissors. But if you teach them to hold them at tummy level, and remind them a few times, the teaching will go so much easier on you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DiCamillo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: absolutely good for 4+. My daughter loves to do this!! she is 4 and half years old. Attached my daughter's work of cutting and pasting
customer_reviews.author: Viswanath

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was bummed when I opened this and saw that the scissors didn't even have a metal edge... and then I USED THEM on the paper and was pleasantly surprised at how well they cut! We have a set of regular pre-K scissors that do have a metal edge and these are definitely easier to use with this workbook. I love how colorful and modern the pages are! What we like to do is have my daughter cut everything out, and then I give her construction paper and a glue stick and have her put it all back together how ever she wants to. REALLY great scissor skills book!
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The price point is great. The pictures are highly motivating. The missing star is only for the included scissors. I can't remember if they were spring loaded or not. If they were, then they broke quickly. Either way, the blade is plastic. I know this is a safety feature, but for occupational therapy purposes, it is tremendously frustrating for the child because nine out of ten cuts have no "reward" -- no impact. The angle has to be DEAD ON. So I'd suggest investing in this (since it is so inexpensive) but providing your own blunt metal safety scissors (with supervision) unless the child is not yet familiar enough with scissors to understand that they "pinch."
customer_reviews.author: Jenn H.

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut through provided paper smoothly
customer_reviews.text: The scissors don’t cut the provided paper very well unless you make sure you hold them very steady and straight which is difficult for little hands. I prefer to use regular kid scissors and monitor them and then put them away when we are done with crafts. My daughter gets a lot more satisfaction from being able to actually cut through the paper instead of it ripping and not working well. We returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Right for a Young 3 years old
customer_reviews.text: The orange scissors is flimsy. My blunt tip supermarket scissors was much better: gives better hand control and added grip. The activity pages were beautiful. However, the shapes were much too complicated for my 3 years old who can only cut straight lines. We found only 1 page that he could do: the trains page. Instead, I did an internet search for improving toddler hand strength and they mentioned using tongs, eye droppers, and ripping construction paper (which teaches moving the hands in opposite direction). This scissors skills is more appropriate for a 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Vannie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book, plastic scissors
customer_reviews.text: Love this workbook. My daughter is 4 and is obsessed with this. We had to limit her to one page per day or she would’ve cut up the whole book at once. The scissors that come with it are orange glittered plastic and don’t have metal blades, so they only cut paper, which is awesome. A slight downfall is that they don’t cut paper once the pieces are very small because the paper just bends with them. I trust my kids with these scissors much more than the ones that we sent to school in their school supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Karly N Little

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Safe scissors.
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are amazing!!! Cuts right through paper but not through anything else (so far). I tried to use them the other day to cut a tag off something and they wouldn’t even cut through that. The book that comes with it seems to give a lot of activities. We did one page and realized quickly his scissor skills should probably be practiced on plain paper for a few more weeks. I’m excited to get back to those when he’s more comfortable holding the scissors. Right now he’s happy to cut any scrap paper we give him into shapes. For only 5$ it’s a great deal. Would be a good gift.
customer_reviews.author: Ryleigh Smith

customer_reviews.title: Scissors broke within a day
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited to get this craft project and our near-4 year old was really into it. He calmly learned how to cut the more simple shapes. However, the metal part of the scissors that enabled the ability to cut fell off within a day rendering the project completely useless. I know it's only $5, but still....
customer_reviews.author: Ishtar7677

customer_reviews.title: Great for pre-K
customer_reviews.text: It was a great practice tool at home for scissors and glue sticks that was also fun. I bought one for my then 5 year old daughter and I wish I had bought a second one because my 7 year old daughter also wanted to do it even though she didn't need practice with scissors so they ended up sharing the book. Would have gotten 2 in retrospect. Comes with scissors which work great. Doesn't come with a glue stick or blank sheets of paper which I recommend you have on hand so they can actually create something with the cut up pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Sahara

customer_reviews.title: Safe for kids 3+
customer_reviews.text: We bought the book for scissor skills for our 3yo. She was able to use the scissors that came with the set. The pages tore off cleanly and easily so she was able to do that herself. I can tell that she really loved doing the worksheets because she went through half a book in a morning! The drawings in the book are simple, and the work gets progressively more challenging. Not quite value for money only because of the speed by which we were done with it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These have been a great activity for my kids in quarantine. They are 3 and 5 so it's been good for them to practice on. They enjoy the scissors and I don't have to worry about them cutting themselves. They like to look at the pad and pick the picture they want to do. The scissors aren't the best but they are safety scissors so they really aren't expected to be. They are on par with other safety scissors I have used.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: It is  safe even for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I really think this is a good purchase for my 2.5 years old. She is interested in watching us using scissors, so I decided to give her one. The scissors come with the product is very safe. It only can cut thin to normal papers. My daughter was able to play with it for around 30 mins by herself in the first few days. I believe it is good for her motor skills. Given the affordability, I think it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Di Zhu

customer_reviews.title: More advanced than expected but beautiful pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Too advanced for my three year old but my 7 year thought these were really cool. There are lots of colorful pictures with varying degrees of difficulty. I feel like the scissors are a little misleading. If your child is young enough to need the plastic scissors this is probably above they skill level by quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5 year olds no so much 4 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 4 year old last year for xmas. She was just starting to use scissors at school so she was excited to get this book. She was just too young to fully grasp the concept of the activities even when I tried to help her. She would just cut thru the paper not on the lines. This was fine and it still helped her but she’s almost 5 now and she totally gets it. Most of the pages have been used and cut up but she found one of them the other day and followed the directions to a T. Going to buy another book so she can get full use out of the activities provided.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great for preschool kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old to practice with safe scissors. She was so excited to try this product out. Her favorite activity was the cutting of ice cream and their cones. The scissor were easy enough for her small hands to handle and not sharp enough that I thought she was going to cut herself. Highly recommend for little kids needing to work on fine motor and cutting skills.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cutting set . It is so cute . The items to be cut out are perfect for little hands . The paper is thick as well, so it’s easy for a toddler to manipulate the page without tearing it .
customer_reviews.author: LBurleson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little cutters
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a Christmas gift for my daughter. The pictures in the book were big and easy for her to learn to use the scissors. The scissors that came with were also a hard orange plastic. There was no "blade" attached to them at all so I felt comfortable letting her practice with them. I would recommend this product to anyone who has a Kindergartner to practice scissor skills.
customer_reviews.author: R Carmody

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this for my 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about how much I love this. The pictures for cutting are easy to understand (where to cut) for my 4 year old. They seem to go in order of skill level from front page to last page - they get trickier (only slightly) which is great. It comes with a pair of blade-less scissors as well which is nice although we just used our own scissors. I’m really glad I got this book, he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel winfield

customer_reviews.title: Dull scissors, engaging booklet
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has really enjoyed the booklet. That said, the scissors are relatively useless. They do cut paper and thankfully little else. Unfortunately they are dull enough that it makes precise cuts difficult. My daughter got pretty frustrated with them but she has cut her hair with her other scissors before. At least I know that she can use the M&D ones without 100% supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Scissors are not great
customer_reviews.text: The scissors and activity book work great together but the scissors themselves are pretty terrible. The paper in the activity book is thicker than most so it cuts nicely with the scissors but if you use the scissors with thinner paper it just folds or crumples. I have had to explain to my daughter these are just practice scissors and not to get frustrated, mommy can’t cut with them either.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: The scissors work great for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my then 4 year old (he’s 5 now). I made copies of the ones I wanted to use that way I can keep the book. I wish there was mostly straight lines in this book and have wavy lines or harder to cut lines in a different book, kind of like a step 1 then step 2. The scissors are perfect for little hands and love using them for our other crafts too! Also their plastic so not dangerous at all.
customer_reviews.author: Liiz

customer_reviews.title: Great activity without the danger of hair cuts
customer_reviews.text: This the perfect set for children wanting to learn how to use scissors. The best part!?... The scissors don't cut hair!!! Just the paper. My 4yo loves being able to cut out each activity and I love that they go in order from easiest to hardest so there is no guessing which activity is best to start with. Time to order another for my 3 yo.
customer_reviews.author: FunFam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Other cutting books make you cut the exercises out before the kids can use, and it becomes impossible to remove the whole page without accidentally leaving some of the exercise in the book. These tear out with a gentle flick of the wrist; the exercises are bright, colorful, and offer a variety of challenges. I'm going to stock up on this product, actually, because my daughter used up the whole book over the course of several hours, improved her cutting skills, and really loved it. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: toomanywords

customer_reviews.title: Scissors are frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: The workbook is super fun and has a variety of pictures and shapes to cut out. There are simple shapes and more complicated ones also, so the book grows with the kids as they become more proficient. I didn't realize the scissors didn't have a real blade like some child's scissors do and these are only plastic. Because of this, the scissors have to be at a precise angle to actually cut or else it just crumples the paper. Once the paper is crumpled, the scissors won't cut well at all. These scissors are more suitable for under 4, I feel. I love the workbook but will be buying a different set of scissors.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Good bue for young kids
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old is just learning how to manage with scissors, and this book has been a lot of fun for her. The activities start out very easy and progressively get harder. The sisters that come with it are the first I've ever seen without a metal blade. They're sharp enough to cut the paper but not the skin, pretty impressive.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: A great activity for preK and K children.
customer_reviews.text: The activities are wonderful. One to add would be a butterfly and a ladybug. I take one page out at a time. The child learns with direction control over scissors and then use a glue stick to paste and place on paper to show her dad when he comes home. Children love to cut with scissors. I give just plain construction paper and a child scissor for her two year old sister. This way they learn to cut constructively and so they don't just cut up things when they get hold of a scissor.
customer_reviews.author: Joan S. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great for Scissor Skills
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for teaching children scissor skills and having fun at the same time. I did not use the scissors included in product. But felt they were save to use if a child was using the product alone, but I work with children one on one and that's why I utilized safety scissors for preschoolers. Scissors included with product were useful and very safe. The children were very proud of their work after they completed activity. Activity had bright lines for easy cutting and fun activities to motivate them to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Nora D.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Rivet, Short Term Life
customer_reviews.text: Our little one loved this scissor upon receiving it. First week went great cutting scrap papers. Though the joy didn't last long enough. The cutting edge has a wide gap now, such that this plastic scissor no longer cuts paper. The rivet that holds two sides is flimsy. I recommend anyone to buy something else but this.
customer_reviews.author: M PATEL

customer_reviews.title: $5 for 20 pages with not great plastic scissors.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that the scissors do not cut well. They work but not as good as real scissors. Also, the scissor holes are just circles (do not have room for 2 fingers on one side). Pages are bright and colorful with activities included (puzzles, matching fruits, pages to cut and then glue into something). However, there are only 20 pages. I think the price is a little high for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: kcrawford

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors skill set
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun kit for a great price! I am a pediatric occupational therapist who works on scissor skills with children in schools all the time and was impressed with the quality of this. My 3 year old is advanced at cutting for her age and could really only do the first two pages, so we are saving it for when she is older. But this is the perfect kit for kindergarten or first/second graders to practice their skills.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcey

customer_reviews.title: The scissors actually work!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised because there's no blade. But they cut nicely! This was such a fun little workbook to get my 4 year old through a couple of days of Covid-boredom. The pictures are beautifully printed. I thought that the pages would be perforated, but they were not. That's neither good, nor bad--just different than what I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Voldemort

customer_reviews.title: Great activity book for my 3 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Melissa & Doug products are fantastic! This is not the first time I bought their product. Very kid friendly and my 3 yr old loves it. This activity book is very colorful and the pictures are big enough to practice cutting! This activity book comes with scissors whereas others show you the scissors but does not come with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kalyk76

customer_reviews.title: Love this! So much more to this then meets the eye!
customer_reviews.text: Great activity! 5 year old loved it! Cutting the images out of the book and pasting them onto a poster has created a huge picture that he loves (because he was able to do it all by himself)!!! Be creative! The scissors work surprisingly well and we have easily taken other images in books or magazines and outlined them with a sharpie to make more pages for him to cut out and paste on his board!! Great concept and continuous play!
customer_reviews.author: MiCoLa

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old loved this!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES cutting out the images. She received this a a stocking gift on Christmas and spent at least 30 uninterrupted minutes cutting. However, she used a different pair of scissors. Although the scissors in the package work, they can be a bit tough to use (which I had seen in other reviews so I purchased another set).
customer_reviews.author: zak

customer_reviews.title: Yay for hands-on learning!
customer_reviews.text: A great way for littles to practice cutting! My youngest two kiddos needed more practice cutting on lines and the colorful pictures make it fun! They also enjoy pasting the cut pieces on a separate piece of paper to put it back together. I'd recommend this to anyone who has little kiddos and looking for a fun hands-on activity. It would be a great activity for a rainy day as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: scissors aren't very good
customer_reviews.text: The games/activities are fun and cute for my 4 year old, but we had to get her a different pair of scissors to use with it. The included scissors are plastic and are just very difficult for her to cut with. The paper in the kit is a good thickness though for kids learning to cut, as it is not too thick, or too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Kael Vanderkolk

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Purchase. Worth $5!
customer_reviews.text: This was like $16 for the longest time and I couldn’t justify buying it. When it went down to $5 I purchased and it’s great (: I don’t think I would want to spend more than $5 because technically you can print these out for yourself and good quality at an Office Max or something, but for $5, why not! (: my son loves it. The scissors aren’t too great but I just went to Walmart to get some $3 kid scissors and now my son is already so much better at his scissor skills. Good purchase (:
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Good intro scissors
customer_reviews.text: Good intro scissors for toddlers/preschoolers, and you don’t have to worry about them cutting up hair or other things! You have to make sure the scissors and paper are straight to work, thus you usually have to be there with the kid. Lots of different pictures and themes with varying levels of difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: T Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity set
customer_reviews.text: Love the scissors that come with it. They’re plastic and better for first time use than the metal ones. I don’t know why people said they wouldn’t cut paper, they cut paper for us just fine. And I don’t have to worry about my little one actually cutting herself by accident till she gets the hang of real scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Nicely packaged but difficult for little hands to operate.
customer_reviews.text: The cut out games (cut out by me) were a lot of fun, however, nearly impossible for my grand son to do alone. The angle that you have to find to cut with these scissors is not kid or adult friendly even though they are meant for children? I went to staples and bought a pair meant for children that worked with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Mommus

customer_reviews.title: Great work book but scissors are wonky
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 5 yr old left handed son and the activities are great. The scissors aren't bad but they aren't great either definitely could use improved. Scissors are difficult for 1st cut and last cut so we had to go to metal types scissors for the more complex projects in the book
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Rippel

customer_reviews.title: Only successful one so far.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter struggles with having any patience to learn something new. This is the only scissor activity book we've used where she hasn't had complete meltdowns. I think it's because she's so excited to do the activity when she's done cutting. Fun things like putting a train together or building a house with the cut out pieces. The skills go in order (straight lines, big curves, small curves, whole circles, etc.) and they're fairly quick activities so it's easy to squeeze into your day, or do more or less depending on frustration levels. We both love this book and it's definitely helping her get the hang of using scissors. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good confidence building skill builder
customer_reviews.text: The cut out pages are made of sturdy weight paper for children to handle. Granddaughter is five and she was able to understand what to do fairly quickly. Some of the pictures are harder to mlaneuver than others. Need to have container to hold pieces that are used for playing. Really liked the pictures to change hair and bodies. Loved the snake cut out. Very clever
customer_reviews.author: Marj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for improving cutting skills
customer_reviews.text: Great for preschoolers to practice their scissor skills in a fun and colorful way. Young children need to develop and strengthen the little muscles in their hands and learning to manipulate scissors provides one way to do that. Small motor skills are necessary as a foundation for writing.
customer_reviews.author: debkdg

customer_reviews.title: Workbook is good, scissors are ineffective
customer_reviews.text: The workbook itself is fine, and my daughter likes it. The scissors, though, are useless. They don't cut at all, unless I am holding the paper taught for her, and even then it's a challenge. Using them got my daughter frustrated with the activity. Ended up replacing them with a pair of safety scissors from the dollar store and they worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Lew

customer_reviews.title: great variety
customer_reviews.text: Its a great way for kids to practice their cutting. It was still a little advanced for my recently 5 year old boy. He just doesn't focus long enough. But my 2 year old girl is already interested in playing with it. Good variety of different cutting skills.
customer_reviews.author: juelaine ricks

customer_reviews.title: Not easy for left handed kids
customer_reviews.text: Great activity book for learning how to use scissors. My 4 year old son really enjoyed it. However he is left handed and the scissors were difficult for him to operate. We bought him a different pair of scissors and now it’s very easy for him to cut and play.
customer_reviews.author: Christa L

customer_reviews.title: Cute and scissors really won't cut hair
customer_reviews.text: The scissors only work well on paper, though you can get them to cut thin fabrics. (Don't ask how I know that.) My son loves this book and surprisingly was actually able to cut on the lines (3 YO). He loves this book though the fun is short-lived. Still if your child loves scissors, they'll like this. I got him an extra pack of the no-cut scissors that includes a patterned scissor - that was really the biggest hit.
customer_reviews.author: Ansley

customer_reviews.title: Works,  but not easily
customer_reviews.text: The book has fun activities, but it was difficult for my child to learn to use these scissors. You have to hold them at exactly the right angle to cut paper. That being said, these scissors are super safe, if you're worried about you child accidentally cutting themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright pictures, great first scissors!
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this. He is two years old and seemed to enjoy cutting the bright pictures provided. Scissors seemed comfortable for him. I still supervised his cutting but it kept him pleasantly occupied for quite awhile. Great first scissors for a toddler for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KCordray

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my preschooler’s Easter Basket. The scissors it comes with aren’t very great, but they are safe (he found them frustrating). Still high marks because he was much more interested in cutting these pages than any of the dotted lines I gave him to try to teach him. They’re cute, kept him occupied, and had a wide variety of line shapes etc.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is really great. My daughter wasn’t very great at cutting and after this she got a lot better. Cutting curves and round things was made easy for her with this book. Only complaint is that we didn’t get the pizza cut out. It has a picture of a pizza and my daughter was excited for it but no pizza. Although I did see pictures of a pizza on other reviews. I think we got two sail boats instead of the pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Really cool!
customer_reviews.text: Must have for your toddler needing to learn scissor skills! And they actually cut, so long as you are holding the scissors straight (which teaches your child proper form). Will have to eventually move onto a bladed scissor, but these are perfect for learning.
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This book is great! Actual parent review!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 1/2 year old is obsessed with this book. The scissors that come with it are just ok, but the quality of the activities in the book are well worth the purchase and warrant 5 stars. The paper is a little heavier than normal printing paper so it doesn’t get all floppy when your kid is cutting. It’s also nice that the things the kids cut out are also activities like puzzles, etc. Just a few pages can keepmy daughter busy for over an hour (supervised, of course). I would buy this as a gift for all the 3-5 year old kids I know.
customer_reviews.author: Actual Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginning to scissors
customer_reviews.text: My daughter didnt put this workbook down. She kept thanking me for her own scissors. I love the concept of this book so much. I wish there were more. There is not a real blade in the scissors which is obviously safer but also makes cutting hard sometimes as it likes to crimp the page instead. We still love it. Would buy more workbooks like this if I found them
customer_reviews.author: TwinMom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old is loving these projects! The scissors it comes with are pretty good for plastic ones but still frustrated my daughter so she uses her regular scissors but the activity sheets themselves are wonderful! I may order another book to print them so she can do them again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Soulless

customer_reviews.title: Not the same safety scissors from the 1980s!
customer_reviews.text: My just-turned 3 year old was highly engaged with it. She was too young to cut the shapes much, but it was a wonderful mother-daughter project where I cut the shapes and provided tape for her to decorate our walls with the shapes. We played little games with the shapes, providing additional learning opportunities. The menu sheet was excellent for helping her choose which of the adorable shapes she wanted me to cut out for her next. The instructions also provided helpful tips. And these are truly "safety" scissors without any metal or ways to cut yourself - not the safety scissors we had in the 80s. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: The scissors are not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The cutting activities are a bit difficult for younger children that are just getting the hang of scissors, lots of rounded cuts. I will hold off on those with my son and give him the straight cut activities. The scissors could be better, hence docking 1-star. It's sharp plastic edging which actually makes it harder to get the paper in cut properly. The paper kept slipping when he tried to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun designs, and skills have improved
customer_reviews.text: A big hit with my kindergartener who needed to work on fine motor skills. The designs are fun and my kiddo is excited to choose a new project each day, so this doesn’t feel like a chore. His scissor skills have improved noticeably in the two weeks we’ve used this.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: This is so adorable! Your child can cut out all sorts of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so adorable! Your child can cut out all sorts of things like a pizza and some pizza toppings, a pumpkin and face pieces to make jack-o-lantern. Ice cream cone and ice cream scoops.. etc...Your child can actually play with what he cuts out. Each item has a thick dotted line to follow to cut out, The scissors are not sharp at all. They are plastic and there is no blade, It is neat how it cuts paper but not really anything else. I will be ordering this again!
customer_reviews.author: Mom3

customer_reviews.title: perfect for cutting practice
customer_reviews.text: we didn't care too much for the scissors it came with but my son is also 5 so for a young child they might not mind. Otherwise great product! really helped us work on my sons scissor holding and cutting skills at home. highly recommend for any pre-k or Kindergarteners
customer_reviews.author: Silverkm@imail.losrios.edu

customer_reviews.title: Nice book for 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old who loves cutting stuff out of paper. She LOVES this book and wad able to do most of the pages without any help. The only downfall is the scissors it comes with are plastic (for safety) but they doubt work well. I have some child safety scissors that have metal blades and she used those.
customer_reviews.author: karin

customer_reviews.title: Scissors are okay...
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old is frustrated trying to use these. They are completely plastic, and safe, but it takes pressure in the right places to cut. He doesn't understand how to hold them to apply the pressure to cut. It's a learning thing, but annoying to try to teach him with these
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pictures are fantastic, the scissors don’t work buy real scissors!
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are great ! My three years old kids love cutting now. But I would make sure to buy real scissors with it. These plastic ones don’t work well and the kids just get frustrated. So A+ for the pictures to cut out. The scissors just toss and buy real metal small ones for kids. Keeps my kids happy for 30 min plus.
customer_reviews.author: Darkcar

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this. For $5 you can a nice sized book full of pages to use the scissors on. Before purchasing I looked for plastic scissors like this for my 3 year old and couldn't find them. Great product, great deal! 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Good first scissor set for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Really cute cutting book for teaching your toddler to cut. The plastic scissors work well on thick paper that’s provided. If you use these on normal thickness paper, your toddler will probably just get frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: S. Choy

customer_reviews.title: Great for homeschooling although I'm sure it'd be a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for homeschooling although I'm sure it'd be a good supplemental for public school as well. My 3 1/2 year old loves having her own scissors. The activity pad goes in order of easiest to hardest. There's absolutely no metal on the scissors like some kid scissors. They cut paper OK but probably won't cut anything else. Check pinterest when you run out of pages in the activity pad for free cutting practice worksheets to print at home & make it last longer!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Scissors are not easy to use for kids. And there were no ideas or suggestions on how to use the pages once they are cut out. (It just seems a bit wasteful). It is a quiet activity for my older child to do while the baby sleeps. So that is a plus. All in all, I wouldn’t recommend this to a friend and I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis P

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get some kid friendly scissors for my 4 yr old to practice with and this set was perfect! I have 2 boys and I really didn’t want them (4&2) to have an actual blade. Really like the variety of the cuts on the illustrations too.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Dison

customer_reviews.title: Fun Rainy Afternoon
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much my 4-year-old enjoyed this activity pad. The "safe" scissors seem to be simultaneously safer and more effective than the metal safety scissors I grew up with, but if you trust your child with real scissors, I think they'll still have a better time of it. (If you hold the plastic ones at the wrong angle, they don't quite grab the paper to cut.) Word to the wise: Take out the trash can and put it right next to the table :-) "Scraps go HERE."
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent skills builder, easily worth the low price.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't open the book which was sealed in plastic as it was a gift but the back cover showed the contents. Looked perfect for my preschooler granddaughter. Multiple projects with enough variety and color to keep kids interested. I'd buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Leah Highgate

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining but need to improve scissors
customer_reviews.text: I work as a nanny and now with shelter in place need to find practical things to keep entertain my kids virtually. Well my kid love it, the only bit I have is that the scissors are hard to use and we end up needing to get a different ones
customer_reviews.author: Abril Garza

customer_reviews.title: good book, poor scissors
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun book for your kids to practice cutting. Beware though that the scissors do not work well at all. They are plastic and do not have blades. I know they are safety scissors for kids, but they end up being just a fake model. I bought some nicer quality child safe scissors and always supervise my kids. Otherwise, this is a great activity book for working on fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Blum Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: While I am a big supporter of Melissa and Doug items, to be honest I was somewhat disappointed with the quality of the scissors with this book. There are completely plastic, which means they don't cut hardly at all. I knew the book would have safety scissors (like Fiskars or something like that) but at least be metal, not completely plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Cole

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to get kids into holding the scissors properly however, it's hard for the younger ones to cut through the paper because the scissors need to be held a certain way to get them to cut through the paper. Other than that I love the concept and all the options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reinforces cutting skills
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to encourage little ones to practice their newfound cutting skills. My 4-year-old granddaughter loves the variety of pictures that she can cut out. I love that the shapes are all different so that she is getting practice on curves as well as straight lines. Also enforces learning shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Grandma

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved it
customer_reviews.text: Keeps her entertain, scissor don't cut through regular paper, it's just meant for this book.
customer_reviews.author: Diana M. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Scissors do work but they are only for cutting paper. Perfect for my 3 year old who wants to cut everything including my new expensive comforter set. No need to buy extra Scissors like I did, listening to the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Graham

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my preschool-aged daughter to work on a sheet a day and practice her cutting before entering kindergarten. The only thing I didn’t like too mucb were the plastic scissors this pack came with, they barely cut through the paper so i just threw them away and let my daughter use an old pair of Friskars that were mine when I was little.
customer_reviews.author: LTutt

customer_reviews.title: Great to teach cutting skills for 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic and fine with a book of cutting activities. The scissors are pretty easy for a toddler to figure out (about 4) and the workbook is cute and just challenging enough to get skills down! My 4.5 year old son loves doing this part of his "homework". My 2 year old can't quite figure out how to cut with these- so probably should be over 3 at least. These also are safe- I'm not sure they could actually cut you but I still have him used supervised and keep put away after use. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: SMP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: So perfect for my 2 and 4 year old. Especially the scissors that come with it. I feel confident leaving them out for my kids to use, since so far, they have only cut paper. I tested them on my hair, and nope, don't cut it!!! It has the perfect amount of pages for both kids to practice, and then gives them fun things to play with later.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Great activities, scissors okay
customer_reviews.text: Loved the different activities. Kept my three year old engaged. The scissors have to be held just right to actually work. Most of the time they were fine but I would recommend using different ones for a child just learning to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome for my niece!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4-year-old neice who needed to work on her scissor skills. It's simple and to the point but it really helped. We used our own scissors and went through the whole thing in just a couple of weeks but her cutting abilities and her steadiness with her hands improved.
customer_reviews.author: cworld1823

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this set. We keep it in the diaper bag for when we’re out and need an activity to keep her busy. It starts off with easy pages Nd gradually gets more complex, she really loves it!
customer_reviews.author: NostalgicMomma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect! I wasn’t expecting much from these plastic little scissors but they surprised me. They are robust and cut paper really well. And better yet they won’t cut hair! My 3 year old son loves cutting paper and will sit for a long time just cutting out the activities in the included book. Will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Edward H

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: These have helped my 5 year really perfect his scissor skills. Bonus, also helped with glue stick skills because naturally he wanted to glue the stuff together after cutting it out. The scissors included aren't the best, but are useable. We ended up using our own scissors. Would still recommend this product for anyone in need of motivation for getting a kid to use scissors properly.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Cute book...scissors tricky
customer_reviews.text: Cute little book. My 3 year old loves it. Scissors need to be exactly perpendicular to the page to work, which makes them a little hard to be used independently by little learners. But the book has lots of neat little activities.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Cute book. Needs better scissors.
customer_reviews.text: The actual activity book is cute. Be aware that the scissors you receive are all plastic so my son had difficulty using them (can use regular child scissors fine). We bought this to bring on a trip and ended up picking up a cheap pair of regular kids scissors to use with the book and threw out the all plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Bunk64

customer_reviews.title: Great practice for my 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: We just started preschool and this is one of those skills the teacher mentioned that they’ll be starting soon. If you have a scanner at home, maybe copy and print extra sheets of pages they particularly love to encourage them to do it again and again. The little scissors were better than I expected too.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: My the year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: We were advised to encourage our the year old to practice scissor skills. I didn't even know that was an area of focus. These are great little projects, and they get more complicated as you work through the book. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Best $5 purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: This one booklet kept our 4 year-old entertained for quite a while. Tons of "projects" to do in here and lots of variety with cutting- from pages with just cutting to other pages where the child can cut and then glue / create something (e.g. a pizza). Melissa and Doug does not disappoint and this book was a very worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful practice of fine motor skills!
customer_reviews.text: This book has been my daughter’s favorite thing from Christmas believe it or not! She loves “doing homework” and her cutting has improved so much. There are so many different desisns to ensure children are cutting straight lines, curves, circles, squares, etc. Great practice! I’ve recommended this to so many people!
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: The plastic scissors are subpar, the content is good
customer_reviews.text: My four year old loves this! He’s getting so good at cutting. The safety scissors it comes with are a little hard to use so he’s been using regular metal safety scissors and it’s been great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: The safety scissors work well! Do the book it order it goes from easy to harder to build up skill and confidence. Good quality papper. We like to use it like a puzzle for a bit after cutting it. My girl just turned 4 and thisis helpful with the hreat pics. She doesn't wanna cut the squiggly lines momma draws..
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Great first scissors!
customer_reviews.text: These have my 2.5 yr old cutting up a storm! They work on paper and for her hand well so there is no frustration. They are a great introduction to cutting and help with fine motor skills. I haven’t used the activity book yet since she is just starting out but saving that for later.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves this book. Although he does attend pre-school, he seemed a little jealous of his brother going off to kindergarten with a new pair of scissors. So I looked for a cutting workbook that he could do at home. This is the one I chose, and it is great. Some of the projects are purely cutting, and some are meant to be glued to another piece of paper. Sometimes, I'll ask him if he wants to do a page of his cutting book and he says no. But, If I tear out a page and set it out with the little scissors that come with it...it will magically be done by somebody...
customer_reviews.author: dusty_puppy

customer_reviews.title: Good for better scissor user
customer_reviews.text: Scissor skills pages very quickly goes up in difficulty. Only a few that are cut in larger sections and straight lines. Definitely better for a child that is already proficient with scissors. The scissors that are included do not cut hair as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Scissors Do Not Cut!
customer_reviews.text: Impossible for adult to even cut with these Scissors. I got so frustrated i wouldn't even give these Scissors to my toddler. Book is cute and we use that but Scissors went to trash. Get metal child safe rounded tip Scissors instead.
customer_reviews.author: ACustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good motor development activity
customer_reviews.text: super cute and good quality activity overall. my very spirited 2.5 year old son enjoyed using the scissors, but is easily frustrated and had no interest in cutting on the lines haha. he is developing the skill, nonetheless and appeared to enjoy himself. scissors are dull plastic with no blade, but cut the paper with surprising ease. I guess I could have bought the scissors separately and saved a lot of money, but even if he didn't enjoy the practice pages I did
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Scissor Skills Activity Book With Pair of Child-Safe Scissors (20 Pages)
product_meta.description:
Style:ActivitiesKids love to cut with scissors—as you can see by the trail of scraps often left in their wake! This creative and practical activity pad gives an engaging, creative direction to scissor work, meaning more concentration and less mess. Organized from simpler to more complex, 20 different paper-cutting projects (with complete supplies included right in the pages of the book) allow children to practice slightly different skills and techniques and produce 20 distinct crafts, games, and activities that offer them a creative focus and a sense of accomplishment. Plastic safety scissors are included, which naturally encourage proper form and are safe for preschoolers—but any pair of scissors can be used to complete the paper-cutting projects. The included safety scissors are child-safe, easy to use, and can be used by right- or left-handed kids. Our scissor skills activity set for kids assists in the development of fine motor skills and cognitive skills. The inclusion of mazes, puzzles, animal art, sequencing activities, and much more stimulates creativity. This child-safe scissors activity set is a great gift for kids ages 4 to 7. Add the Melissa & Doug Reusable Sticker Pad – Habitats Set to round out the hands-on play experience and give kids an engaging option for screen-free fun. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: HELPS CHILDREN PRACTICE SCISSOR SKILLS: The Melissa & Doug Scissor Skills Activity Book is a paper-cutting project book with 20 pre-printed activity pages. This cutting book includes child safety scissors.
DURABLE CHILD SAFETY SCISSORS: To encourage children 4 to 7 years old to learn how to use scissors safely, we’ve included plastic safety scissors that naturally encourage proper form.

ENCOURAGES FINE MOTOR SKILLS: Our scissor-skills activity set for kids assists in the development of fine motor skills and cognitive skills. The inclusion of mazes, puzzles, animal art, sequencing activities, and much more stimulates creativity.

GREAT GIFT FOR AGES 4 TO 7: This scissor activity set is an ideal gift for kids ages 4 to 7. Add the Melissa & Doug Reusable Sticker Pad – Habitats Set to round out the hands-on play experience and give kids an engaging option for screen-free fun.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”
